description: From New Latin anergia, from Ancient Greek ἀν- (an-, “not, without”) + ἔργον (érgon, “work”).

entries.meaning: (physics) Dilute or disorganized energy, which cannot be transformed into work.
examples: The maximum fraction of an energy form which (in a reversible process) can be transformed into work is called exergy. The remaining part is called anergy, and this corresponds to the waste heat.

entries.meaning: (immunology) Lack of immunity to an antigen.
